intro: Rhinanthus acuminatus, commonly known as the common tickseed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species, and it is a hemiparasitic plant that partially relies on host plants for water and nutrients. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides, meadows, and woodland edges. It produces yellow-orange flowers in clusters, which are visited by various pollinators including bees and flies. Rhinanthus acuminatus plays a role in supporting biodiversity by providing nectar and habitat for insects.
